gui.frame

Class NKFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.frame.NKFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class NKFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A class extended from JFrame custom made for NKSD Copy Center. Generates a UI that is similar to the program for the previous year.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Phil Adriaan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      NKFrame()

    • Field Detail

      • my_data_manager

        private DataManager my_data_manager
        Holds the current instance of all data required for the program.

      • my_current_component

        private javax.swing.JComponent my_current_component
        The component that is currently active on the frame. It holds everything that is visualized currently.

      • my_current_panel

        private PanelEnum my_current_panel
        The enum for the panel that is currently shown in the frame.

      • my_current_text_pane

        private javax.swing.JTextPane my_current_text_pane
        The text pane that is currently shown on the frame if there is one.

      • my_current_table

        private NKTable my_current_table
        The table that is currently shown on the frame if there is one.

      • my_toolbar

        private NKToolBar my_toolbar
        The toolbar that is shown on the frame.

      • my_field_map

        private final java.util.Map<FieldEnum,javax.swing.JComponent> my_field_map
        For storing all the fields that are needed for the program. Maps the fields to each field enums.

      • my_location_filter_box

        private NKComboBox my_location_filter_box
        Drop down menu to filter the locations in the user panel.

      • my_order_filter_button

        private javax.swing.JToggleButton my_order_filter_button
        Toggle button to filter the orders by date in the order panel. This button will only be enabled in the order panel. The default filter filters orders made in the last 2 weeks.

      • my_location_selection_box

        private NKComboBox my_location_selection_box
        Drop down menu for selecting locations in the order panel. Will automatically change to the default location of the selected user if a new user is selected.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NKFrame

        public NKFrame()
        Creates the frame by calling the JFrame constructor, then creates custom elements that is specifically designed for the program.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        private void start()
        Starts the GUI by making a loading screen, make the frame visible, maximize the frame, and set the default close action. The program the reads all the tables and populate the data manager with its data.It

      • setOrderFilter

        private void setOrderFilter()
        Adds an action listener into the order filter button to make it usable.

      • setLocationFilter

        private void setLocationFilter()
        Creates the drop down menu for the location filter at the users panel, and also adds an action listener to it to make it usable.

      • drawTable

        public void drawTable(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> the_data)
        Updates the current table from a collection of data. Used only to update and refresh current table and not for creating new tables.
        Parameters:
        the_data - A 2D list of data to be updated on the table. The data represented on the table will be in the exact same structure as the data ordered in the 2D list.

      • setDateField

        private void setDateField(FieldEnum the_enum)
        Sets the date fields for the user to be able to choose dates from. Will create a new JDateChooser instance and adds it to the field mapping. Format of the date will be M/d/y.
        Parameters:
        the_enum - The field enum that the date fields will be mapped to. To make sure that the results are displayed correctly, make sure that it is mapped to only date related fields.

      • setUserField

        private void setUserField()
        Sets the user field for the user to be able to select users from. It will create a drop down menu containing all the user information, and adds a listener to automatically select the default location of the selected user in the location selection drop down menu. The default location will be the first location in alphabetical order which the budget code matches the 3 digit location code of the selected user.

      • setProductField

        private void setProductField()
        Sets the product field by creating a drop down box containing the name and price information of all available products.

      • setInputField

        private void setInputField(FieldEnum the_enum)
        Sets the fields for numerical inputs. Creates JTextFields and adds document listeners to detect any changes made on the field so that it can notify the output fields for new values.
        Parameters:
        the_enum - Enums for the field type to be mapped with. Only to be mapped with field types that requires numerical inputs.

      • setOutputField

        private void setOutputField(FieldEnum the_enum)
        Sets the output fields for users to see the results of their selections. The output fields are not editable and are filtered to only allow limited information to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        the_enum - Enums for the field type to be mapped with. Will only accept output fields, otherwise it is ignored.

      • setField

        private void setField()
        Sets all of the fields by scanning through the enum for the required fields to be mapped, then determine the type of fields that should be mapped to the enum and creates the fields and its listeners if needed.

      • sync

        private void sync()
        Syncs the input and output fields. When a change in an input field is detected, it will be read and displayed on the output fields in correct format. Invalid inputs will be ignored.

      • getLocationFilterBox

        public NKComboBox getLocationFilterBox()
        Gets the location filter box used in the users panel.
        Returns:
        The drop down menu to be used in the users panel for filtering

      • getFields

        public java.util.Map<FieldEnum,javax.swing.JComponent> getFields()
        Gets all the fields used in the order panel.
        Returns:
        All the fields available at the order panel.

      • getDataManager

        public DataManager getDataManager()
        Gets the current instance of the data manager.
        Returns:
        Current instance of the data manager.

      • getPanel

        public PanelEnum getPanel()
        Gets the current screen that is shown in the frame.
        Returns:
        Information of the panel that is currently shown in the frame.

      • getTextPane

        public javax.swing.JTextPane getTextPane()
        Gets the current text pane.
        Returns:
        Current instance of the text pane. Will only give correct information if the text pane is currently shown in the frame

      • getTable

        public NKTable getTable()
        Gets the current Table.
        Returns:
        Current instance of the table. will only give correct information if the current panel is the order panel.

      • setPanel

        public void setPanel(PanelEnum the_panel_enum,
            java.lang.String the_message)
        Changes the panel to a new panel. This method will rename the title to the desired panel, remove the old panel if there is any, and create a new panel according to the desired panel. The panel will then be refreshed to show it on screen. It will also configure all panel specific components to the default state. Some of it include the order filter button and the user filter drop down menu.
        Parameters:
        the_panel_enum - Screen to be changed to.
        the_message - Message to be displayed if the panel to be changed is the message screen.
